name: Kali sulphuricum
Relationship: Compare: KALI-SULPH. CHROMIC. ALUM OF CHROME - 3X. (Produces in the nasal passages very fine threads from the septum to external wall; affections of nasal fossae and hay-fever. Chronic colds. Sneezing, red, watery eyes, irritation of mucous membrane). PULSAT.; KALI-BICH.; NAT-M.

Head: Dandruff and scaldhead
Bald spots
Rheumatic headache, beginning in evening
Fever: Intermittent fever, with yellow, slimy tongue
Abdomen: Colicky pains; abdomen feels cold to touch; tympanitic, tense
Respiratory: Cough; worse in evening and in hot atmosphere
Nose: Engorgement of the nasal pharyngeal mucous membrane, mouth breathing, snoring, etc., remaining after removal of adenoids
Female: Menses too late, scanty, with feeling of weight in abdomen
Skin: Ring-worm of scalp or beard with abundant scales
Extremities: Pain in nape, back and limbs, worse in warm room

details: Ailments accompanied by profuse desquamation. Applicable to the later stages of inflammation. YELLOW, mucous and serous discharges, profuse and intermittent. Has been found of much use in oxaluria.
